titles.title: To direct the Secretary of the Interior to release reversionary interests held by the United States in certain parcels of land in Washington County, Utah, to facilitate an anticipated land exchange.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Resources.
Referred to the Subcommittee on National Parks and Public Lands.
Mr. Hansen moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 2862.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.
Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Hearings held.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

calendar.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

committee.name: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

action.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources. Reported to Senate by Senator Murkowski without amendment. With written report No. 106-241.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 457.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 9/14/1999--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the Interior to release, without consideration, the reversionary interests of the United States in certain real property located in Washington County, Utah, to facilitate a land exchange to be conducted by Utah.
